title: Requirements: User is able to exit the app by pressing the BACK button
DL: Verify entitled user is able to Link directly into a Archive Game
custom_steps:
WHEN deeplink is created with valid content ID  

example: 531111      (this is a LAD@OAK <mailto:LAD@OAK>  8/7/2018 game and may not be valid link when 2020 season begins)

AND deeplink is sent to device
custom_expected: THEN the app will launch and user is sent to video playback of the specified archive content

title: DL: Verify that if the User is given a bad link, they are redirected back to the Main App Screen
custom_steps: WHEN deeplink is created with missing or malformed content ID
custom_expected: THEN the app will launch and user is redirected to main app screen (Home or Scores per user's preference is setting)

title: DL: Verify unauthenticated user is redirected to error message (then default app view)
custom_steps:
WHEN deeplink is created with valid content ID  

example: 531111      (this is a LAD@OAK <mailto:LAD@OAK>  8/7/2018 game and may not be valid link when 2020 season begins)

AND deeplink is sent to device
custom_expected:
THEN the app will launch and user is presented an error message alerting them Login with MLB.tv  entitled account is required.

 

note: ticket logged for better UX to prompt user with login screen, has been resolved as wont fix, but may be re-opened in Roku cert calls out issue. https://jira.bamtechmedia.com/browse/MLBROKU-1041

title: Audio: Launch Audio Feed - Confirm Appearance
custom_steps: WHEN we activate any Audio Feed.
custom_expected:
THEN we see feed select menu closes

AND feed launches as expectedÍ¾ expected audio plays

AND user is returned to screen from which the game was selected

title: Audio: Audio Feed Playback with Wireless Connection
custom_steps:
WHEN we play audio

AND it plays through from near beginning to completion.
custom_expected:
THEN audio plays back as expected

AND audio player stops when user manually stops the feed

note: launching another feed (audio or video) stops the current playing feed)

title: Audio: Audio Feed Playback with Wired Connection
custom_steps:
WHEN we play audio

AND it plays through from near beginning to completion.
custom_expected:
THEN audio plays back as expected

AND audio player stops when user manually stops the feed

note: launching another feed (audio or video) stops the current playing feed)

title: Audio: Verify Player Controls function as expected
custom_steps: WHEN we launch a audio feed
custom_expected: THEN the controls will function as displayed: Stop Playing (Located in the Options Side Menu or feed select of game) : Audio feed stops playing

title: Recon: Verify that recon data is generated after "30 seconds" of video playback.
custom_steps:
WHEN the user watches at least 30 seconds of video playback

AND the user exits the video stream

AND the user then selects the same video stream
custom_expected: THEN a new option for watching the game will appear called "Resume" which will bring the user to where they left off.

title: Recon: User returns to a previous streamed game, the Resume option is present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the game

AND attempts to Watch the feed
custom_expected: THEN the Choose start Option menu will include the option to Resume

title: Recon: Verify that Recon data will be erased and the Resume option is unavailable once the user has reached the end of a video
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the previously watched game

AND attempts to watch it again
custom_expected: THEN the user will not see the Resume option, only Start from Beginning

title: Start: User selects Resume
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the previously watched game

AND attempts to watch it again

AND presses the Resume option
custom_expected: THEN the video stream will continue where the user left off

title: Start: User selects Start from beginning
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the game

AND chooses the option to Watch

AND selects 'Start from beginning
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will launch

AND the stream will restart at the beginning

title: Start: User selects Jump to inning
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects to watch an MLB.TV archive

AND selects the 'Jump to inning' option
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to an inning navigation control

AND selecting this will bring the user to the corresponding video location

title: Start: Verify Resume is not an available option for a stream that has not been started before by the user
custom_steps:
WHEN the user chooses to Watch an MLB.TV feed

AND has not previously attempted to watch this feed
custom_expected: THEN the user will NOT see the 'Resume' option in the Choose start option menu

title: Delayed State: Verify Game Detail view is clickable and no longer updating with post delay data
custom_steps: WHEN we observe the Feed Select
custom_expected: THEN we no longer see any data updating with post Delay data

title: Delayed State: Verify Game appears as 'Delayed' on Score Tile
custom_steps: When the game goes into or is put into a Delayed state
custom_expected: Then that state is indicated on the game tile

title: Delayed State: Verify Game appears as 'Delayed' on Home Team View
custom_steps: When the game goes into or is put into a Delayed state
custom_expected: THEN that state is indicated

title: Delayed State: Verify all possible delayed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of delay, Rain, Snow, Ceremony, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the delayed state without issue

title: Playback: Verify that if a user has previously linked to an MLB.tv Account are able to start up a game stream with the correct subscription
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to start up an MLB.TV stream that is not blacked out
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the MLB.TV stream successfully

title: Playback: Verify that we can play an MLB.tv Stream while utilizing a WiFi Connection
custom_steps: WHEN user selects an a video (that is not blacked out)
custom_expected:
THEN video playback will stream without issue

 

note: if wifi strength is poor, the bitrate of video playback should be lower; video quality may not be as good, but it is intended to prevent stuttering playback when device is unable to download and playback the higher bitrate/quality video.

title: Playback: Verify that we can play an MLB.tv Stream while utilizing a Wired Connection
custom_steps: WHEN user selects an a video (that is not blacked out)
custom_expected: THEN video playback will stream without issue

title: Playback: Pressing the OK button brings up game overlay information (Matchup/Date)
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects a (non blacked out) video to play

AND video player launches to full screen playback

AND user presses (OK) button on Roku remote
custom_expected:
THEN video player overlay displays

AND video description (provided by the video metadata) displays 

 

NOTE: the amount of information displayed/available in the overlay is dependent on the device's capabilities;

lowend devices can't show very much (ex: Roku 3, Roku Express)

examples: dark grey overlay with team matchup, score, and/or date

 

highend devices can display much more. (ex: Roku Ultra)

example: games may have matchup and date with additional navigable milestones, linescore and box score

title: Playback: Verify Full VOD Video Playback to Exit
Playback: Verify Full Live Linear Playback to Exit
Game: Final State: Verify Game appears as 'Final' on the Info Overlay and in the Game Detail view
custom_steps: WHEN there is a game that has gone Final
custom_expected: THEN the game should appear as Final on the Info Overlay and in the Game Detail view

title: Game: Final State: Verify a game that ends early appears correctly on Game Detail view
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a game that ends before 9 innings in mid inning

OR there is a game that ends before 9 innings after the completion of an inning
custom_expected:
THEN the game should appear and act as Final game on the Info Overlay

AND the game should appear and act as Final game in the Game Detail view once selected

title: Game: Final State: Verify a game that ends normally appears correctly on Game Detail view
custom_steps: WHEN a game has completed
custom_expected:
THEN game will appear as a Final Game on the Info Overlay

AND the game will appear as a Final Game in the Game Detail view

title: Game: Final State: Verify a game that ends with extended periods appears correctly on Game Detail view (in both mid inning and complete innings)
custom_steps:
WHEN a game has completed in extra innings

AND the user selects the game
custom_expected:
THEN it should appear as a Final game in the Game Details

AND it should be indicated that the game went more than 9 innings, (eg. Final/12)

title: Game: Final State: Verify that when a game has been completed early that it's displayed as 'Final/n'
custom_steps:
WHEN a game has been 'Completed Early'

AND we navigate to Game Detail view for that specific game
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the game status as 'Final/n'

n = a number less than 9

title: Suspended State: Verify Game appears as 'Suspended' on Scores Tile

custom_steps: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_expected:

And the game will appear as suspended in all the Gameday Detail view

custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of suspension, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the suspended state without issue

title: Suspended State: Verify suspended game is sorted properly in the scoreboard according to the sorting rules
custom_steps: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_expected:
Then the game should move to the bottom of the list past the games that are in progress

And the game should move to the bottom of the list past the games that are still scheduled to be played

title: Suspended State: Verify Game Detail view is no longer updating with post delay data

custom_expected:

custom_expected: Then it should reflect the Postponed state without issue

Options: Pressing the * Button on the Roku Remote will show the Options Side Bar on any page featuring the Options

Options: Selecting the Scores button will bring the user to the Scores Screen
Options: Selecting the Settings button will bring the user to the Settings
Options: Stop Playing Button only appears when there is an audio feed playing*
Options: Selecting the Stop Playing button will end the current audio feed*

Options: Selecting the Standings Button will bring the user to the Standings Screen
Options: Selecting the Videos Button will bring the user to the Videos Screen

custom_expected:

title: Standings: Info shown on either Divisional or Wild Card matches info shown on MLB.com
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects Standings form the menu

AND view the standings data in the Roku MLB app

AND compares (off device with web browser) the corresponding Standings on MLB.com website
custom_expected: THEN the standings will have the same data reflected on web mlb.com and in Roku mlb app

custom_steps:
WHEN Standings page is displayed

AND user observes their favorite Team's row
custom_expected: THEN a filled colored start will appear to the left of the team name and logo indicating it's a favorite

custom_steps:
WHEN user selects Standings form the menu

AND views the leagues and teams in the Roku MLB app

AND compares (off device with web browser) the corresponding teams on MLB.com website
custom_expected: THEN the teams and Leagues will reflect the same information on both mlb.com and in Roku MLB.tv app app

title: Standings: Verify 'hints' appear at the bottom of screen and can be easily seen by the user
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the Wild Card Standings
custom_expected: THEN a key/hints appear along the bottom of the screen to identify wild card status identifiers

title: Video: All videos on this screen are grouped in sections (Recent, Statcast, Outstandings)
Favorite: All videos on this screen should be curated to the user's favorite team if they have one selected

Video: Each Section located on this screen should feature a carousel featuring $(10) videos pertaining to that section
Video: Reaching the end of each section's carousel will feature a "See More" Option that would bring the user to a full list of videos for said section
Changer: Selecting the Favorite Team Changer will open up a drop down menu for the user to pick a new team.
Changer: The drop down menu will be ordered alphabetically while any team the user is following will be curated into their own group for ease-of-use
Changer: Selecting any new team will replace all the video tiles with new videos pertaining to the new favorite team

title: Login: Verify Login Success (Menu)
custom_steps:
WHEN user opens Menu  - press (*) button on remote

AND selects Sign In

AND enters valid mlb.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN the credentials will be accepted

AND user is logged in

AND Successful Log In message is displayed:

Header: Successful Log In

Text: Congratulations and welcome to the new MLB.tv app!

Your teams settings and hide scores preferences will be saved to your account

button: [OK]

title: Login: Verify Login Success (Settings)
custom_steps:
WHEN user opens Menu  - press (*) button on remote

AND selects Settings

AND select Sign In

AND enters valid mlb.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN the credentials will be accepted

AND user is logged in

AND Successful Log In message is displayed:

Header: Successful Log In

Text: Congratulations and welcome to the new MLB.tv app!

Your teams settings and hide scores preferences will be saved to your account

button: [OK]

title: Login: Verify Login Success (feed select)
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects an archived or Live game tile
AND user selects LOGIN from the feed select message
AND user enters valid mlb.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN the feed select menu opens with log in prompt
THEN the login screen displays
THEN the credentials will be accepted

AND user is logged in

AND Successful Log In message is displayed:

Header: Successful Log In

Text: Congratulations and welcome to the new MLB.tv app!

Your teams settings and hide scores preferences will be saved to your account

button: [OK]

title: Login: Verify Login failed
custom_steps: WHEN user enters invalid MLB.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN Login Error Message displays:

Header: Log In Error

Text: The email address or password was incorrect.

Please verify your login credentials and try again.

Button: [OK]

title: Login: Verify virtual keyboard allows (email and password) input
custom_steps: WHEN virtual keyboard displays for Email and Password entry
custom_expected:
THEN each key will be functioning 

AND user is able to enter their email and password for authentication

title: Login: Verify after incorrectly entering credentials the user is able to enter credentials again
custom_expected:
THEN user is returned to password entry screen
AND can navigate back to email entry screen
AND is able to re-enter and submit credentials

title: Login: Verify Messaging when the user enters an empty email
custom_steps:
WHEN Enter email screen is displayed

AND user selects [OK] button without entering email (leaving the field blank)
custom_expected:
THEN the screen does Not progress to password entry

AND an error message displays above the email entry filed alerting user:

"Error: User name can't be empty"

AND user can enter their email

title: Login: Verify Messaging when the user enters an empty password
custom_steps:
WHEN Enter password screen is displayed

AND user selects [OK] button without entering password (leaving the field blank)
custom_expected:
THEN an error message displays above the password entry filed alerting user:

"Error: Password can't be empty"

AND user must enter their password before they can proceed to next screen

title: Calendar: Verify Calendar Team Selector correctly displays
custom_steps: WHEN user selects the Calendar view option button in the upper left corner (text reads: ALL TEAMS)
custom_expected: THEN a drop down menu displays a scrollable Team picker menu

title: Calendar: Verify Team Calendar correctly displays selected team's scheduled games
Calendar: Verify Team Future Game Tiles can be activated
custom_steps: WHEN user selects any day beyond TODAY
custom_expected:
THEN Future tile opens up the day's Games


WITH the team's game in focus by default

title: Calendar: Verify Calendar allows navigation to previous (1) seasons & current
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates back through the seasons' schedule using the back arrows left of the Month
custom_expected: THEN user is only able to view schedule back to the beginning of the previous season's Spring Training (February of previous year)

title: Changer: Selecting the Favorite Team Changer will open up a drop down menu for the user to pick a new team.
custom_steps:
WHEN the user highlights the Current Team in the top left corner

AND selects said option
custom_expected: THEN a drop down menu will open for the user to pick a new team.

title: Changer: Verify opening the Calendar Screen will default to show all Teams instead of current Favorite Team
Changer: Verify Followed Teams are identified in the Team chooser menu
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the <Team> /All Team picker (in upper left corner) AND observes the teams list
custom_expected: THEN the Followed teams will display in their own section labeled Followed Teams

title: Changer: Selecting any new team will replace all the tiles with new information pertaining to the new favorite team
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects ALL Teams

AND selects a team from the list in the drop down menu
custom_expected:
THEN the calendar view updates to display the selected Team's schedule for the displayed month

AND for the previous and current seasons

title: Team: Home Screen loads user's favorite team (games and videos)
custom_steps: WHEN the user enters the Team View Screen
custom_expected:
THEN the Team View Screen will appear with the user's favorite team and all of its relevant information appears to the user including:

Most Recent's Game, Future Game, Recent Highlights, and Team News.

title: Team: Selecting Home without favorite team displays prompt to choose one
custom_steps: WHEN the user goes to Team View
custom_expected: THEN the user will be prompted to choose a favorite team

title: Team: Home view available games list
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the Team View Screen
custom_expected: THEN the user will be greeted with the Team View Screen featuring the latest game played/playing or the next up and coming game by the user's current favorite team

title: Team: Future games display below today's (or most recent) game
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the bottom of the screen
custom_expected: THEN user will be see and be able to highlight future game tiles for their current favorite team.

title: Team: On this screen, the user will also see the most recent highlights and Team News pertaining to the current favorite team
custom_steps: WHEN the user access the Team View Screen
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be presented with the most up to date information and videos of the user's current favorite team listed under two

sections: Team Highlights and Team News.

title: Hide: With Hide Scores OFF, All data for the current game will display, as well as, the most recent highlight and Team News Videos
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the Team View Screen
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be able to see all relevant information including: highlights, news, and the most current game regarding their current

favorite team

title: Hide: With Hide Scores ON, the current game tile will only display the team logos with a message explaining the Hide Scores is ON
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the Team View Screen
custom_expected:
THEN the current game title will display FINAL plus the two team logos.

ALSO the main title will explain that Hide Scores is ON and how to change it

title: Hide: With Hide Scores ON, Recent Highlights and Team News Section is covered by a large black tile with a message about Hide Scores
custom_steps:
WHEN the user accesses the Team View Screen
AND when the user taps Reveal Highlights
custom_expected:
THEN Recent Highlights and Team News Section would be covered by a large black tile with a message about Hide Scores and where to change them
THEN highlights are revealed

title: Changer: Selecting the Favorite Team Changer will open up a drop down menu for the user to pick a new team.
custom_steps:

AND selects the Team Changer
custom_expected: THEN the Favorite Team Changer will open up showing all the teams alphabetically according to MLB.com

title: Changer: The drop down menu will feature all following teams into its own list called "My Teams"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user highlights the Current Team in the top left corner

AND selects the Team Changer
custom_expected: Then the favorite and followed teams will appear under My Teams at the top of the list

title: Changer: Selecting any new team will replace all the tiles with new information pertaining to the new favorite team
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Current Team in the top left corner

AND selects a new team that isn't the current favorite team
custom_expected: THEN the Team View Screen will update all information to the new current favorite team.

title: Changer: Selecting any new team will replace the background of this section to be the home stadium of the new currently selected favorite team
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Current Team in the top left corner

AND selects a new team that isn't the current favorite team

AND the user allows for the Team View Screen to update
custom_expected: THEN the user will notice the background has changed to reflect a new stadium that belongs to the new current favorite team.

title: Settings: Verify actionable list of items
Hide/Show: Hide/Show Settings are updated once the user signs into an account.
Hide/Show: Hide/Show Settings are retained when the user leaves the application and reenters
Settings: Once the user press the back arrow, the user should return to the previous screen
Settings: Selecting the Log In will bring the user to the Login Screen.
Settings: Selecting the Log Out Button will log the user out of their account, restricting the user from watching game feeds
$Settings: Selecting the Start Up Preference will switch between Home (Favorite Team) or Scores (League) .
Condensed: Verify an unlinked user is unable to watch Condensed Video Feeds
Condensed: Verify if we have linked to a Free MLB Account , the user is able to watch Condensed Feeds
Condensed: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Annually subscribed account, the user is able to watch Condensed Feeds
Condensed: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Monthly subscribed account, the user is able to watch Condensed Feeds
Condensed: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Gameday Audio account, the user is able to view the Condensed Feeds
Condensed: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Single Team account, the user is able to watch Condensed Feeds*
Condensed: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Executive account, the user is able to watch Condensed Feeds
Condensed: Verify that after the Condensed Video ends, that the user is returned to the Feed Selection Screen
Feed: Verify selecting 'TV feed' overlays TV Broadcast Audio with video
Feed: Verify selecting 'Local radio' overlays Radio Broadcast with video
Feed: Verify selecting 'Spanish' overlays Spanish Radio Broadcast with video
Feed: Verify selecting 'Ballpark sound' overlays the non-announcer audio with the video playback
Feed: Verify changing Audio Feed settings for one game does not apply to all games
Feed: Verify Audio Feed changes reset to default when the user leaves the Feed Select Screen
Recap: Verify an unlinked user is unable to watch Game Recaps
Recap: Verify if we have linked to a Free MLB Account, the user is able to watch Game Recaps
Recap: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Annually subscribed account, the user is able to watch Game Recaps
Recap: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Monthly subscribed account, the user is able to watch Game Recaps
Recap: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Gameday Audio account, the user is able to view the Game Recaps
Recap: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Single Team account, the user is able to watch Game Recaps*
Recap: Verify that if a user has linked to an MLB.tv Executive account, the user is able to watch Game Recaps
Recap: Verify that after the Game Recap ends, that the user is returned to the Feed Selection Screen
Verify: When choosing the 'Watch' option for an Archive, the user sees a 'Jump to inning' option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects playable Archive game content

AND presses the select button on the deviceâ€™s remote to bring up the Video Options (Condensed, Recap, etc.)

AND selects the Home or Away feed
custom_expected: THEN a Watch options menu appears with options to â€œStart from the Beginningâ€￾ or â€œJump to Inningâ€￾

title: Inning: Selecting 'Jump to inning' opens appropriate navigation page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects playable Archive game content

AND presses the select button on the deviceâ€™s remote to bring up the Video Options (Condensed, Recap, etc.)

AND selects the Home or Away feed

AND on the Watch options menu the user chooses â€œJump to Inningâ€￾
custom_expected: THEN the appropriate navigation page opens

title: Inning: 'Jump to inning' displays proper inning information for selected game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects playable Archive game content

AND presses the select button on the deviceâ€™s remote to bring up the Video Options (Condensed, Recap, etc.)

AND selects the Home or Away feed

AND on the Watch options menu chooses â€œJump to Inningâ€￾

AND user scrolls through the navigation page up and down
custom_expected: THEN scrolling through the Tops and Bottoms of the Innings, there are enough Innings to choose from that represent if the game went the normal 9 innings, more than 9, or in some cases less than 9 (for example, see TOR-NYY game on 8/17/2018)

title: Inning: Selecting an inning accurately jumps the user to the appropriate video position
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects playable Archive game content

AND presses the select button on the deviceâ€™s remote to bring up the Video Options (Condensed, Recap, etc.)

AND selects the Home or Away feed

AND on the Watch options menu chooses â€œJump to Inningâ€￾

AND on the â€œJump to Inningâ€￾ page user chooses the TOP or BOTTOM of a particular inning
custom_expected: THEN the user will be accurately jumped to the appropriate video position

title: Inning: Matchup logos appear accurately
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects playable Archive game content

AND presses the select button on the deviceâ€™s remote to bring up the Video Options (Condensed, Recap, etc.)

AND selects the Home or Away feed

AND on the Watch options menu chooses â€œJump to Inningâ€￾
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the appropriate and accurate team logos in the correct positions for AWAY (on top left of page) and HOME (on top right of page) teams

UI: During Hide Scores Off for VOD; Time Elapsed, Video Length, Away Team @ Home Team and a Bar that moves based on time elapsed is shown
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches an Archive Game

AND observes the Timeline UI
custom_expected:
THEN the timeline will show the total running time for the game

AND the timeline bar will move as time elapses during the content

title: UI: During Hide Scores ON for VOD, User is shown only a filling bar based on time elapsed and the Away Team @ Home Team
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches an Archive Game

AND observes the Timeline UI
custom_expected:
THEN the timeline will NOT show the total running time for the game

AND the timeline bar will "fill in" as time elapses during the content

AND the Away Team @ Home Team are displayed

title: UI: Pressing the Play/Pause Button would Play/Pause the video
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches playable content

AND attempts to press the Play/Pause button on the deviceâ€™s remote
custom_expected:
THEN the Play/Pause button is usable

AND button functions as expected (during playback pressing Play/Pause button Pauses the content; during Paused playback pressing Play/Pause button Plays the content) without issue

title: UI: Pressing <</>> buttons Rewind/Fast-Forward the video
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches playable content

AND attempts to press the FFW or REW button on the deviceâ€™s remote
custom_expected: THEN the FFW or REW buttons are usable and they function as expected (during playback pressing the FFW or REW buttons Fast Forwards or Rewinds the content) without issue

title: UI: Pressing either the << or >> multiple times will slowly increase the speed of REWIND/FF
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches playable content

AND attempts to press the FFW or REW button on the deviceâ€™s remote

AND presses the chosen button multiple times (up to 6 (non-Highlight) or up to 3 (Highlights))
custom_expected:
THEN the FFW or REW buttons are usable and they function as expected (during playback pressing the FFW or REW buttons Fast Forwards or Rewinds the content) without issue

AND with each button press the speed of FFW or REW increases incrementally, up to 64x the speed (for non-Highlights) OR up to 3x the speed (for Highlights)

AND (for Highlights) the UI will have FFW or REW icons that look like a double triangle OR (for Highlights) the UI will have 1-3 triangle icon indicators depending on how many times the button has been pressed

PR: Transport controls are unavailable during Ad playback, only Pause/Play
custom_steps:
WHEN a *video is launched

AND Pre-roll plays before video content

 

*examples:  Free Game of the Day, video clip or highlight
AND user presses Pause/Play on remote
AND user presses Rev scan & Fwd scan
custom_expected:
THEN the pre-roll ad pauses or resumes playback in accordance with button presses and current video state
THEN Scan buttons are disabled and have no effect on pre-roll

AND video continues to play without interruption

An advertisement will be seen
